title: 'Knife for Kitchen'
body: The Solimo Chef's Knife boasts a sturdy stainless steel blade that is resistant to staining, paired with a comfortable handle for safe and efficient use. This excellent knife has a very sharp blade made of strong stainless steel. It's great for cutting things accurately and precisely. The handle of the knife is firmly attached to the blade with three rivets. The blade is made of stainless steel and runs through the entire handle for added durability.

title: 'Need improvement in the sharpness.'
body: Cons:- When first time i got Solimo's chef's knife. It was sharp like razor blade i even injured with the kinfe. After one month of use it has lost its sharpness. title: 'Ergonomic
body: sharp knife'
column6: Found the weight distribution on this knife to be perfect. Handle is an extension of the steel blade riveted properly with plastic grips.  Please learn how to hold a chef's knife correctly. Most people making YouTube review videos of this knife are holding it wrong and wierd. If the weight is not distributed properly in your hand it's not effective. And it may slip and leave you with 9 or 8 fingers!  Also please buy a carbide stone and sharpen every month. Maintenance is required. Even Japanese Sushi masters maintain their knives regularly. Without maintenance the edge becomes dull, that's normal.
